Container.Name: HandBrake
Container.Overview: HandBrake is a tool for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. A fully automated mode is also available: drop files into a watch folder and let HandBrake process them without any user interaction. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 80MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake/blob/master/README.md[/a]. [br][br] [span style='color: red;'][b]NOTE:[/b][/span] For the container to have access to your optical drive(s), you need to allow access to the proper device (usually [b][i]/dev/sr0[/i][/b]) by adding the parameter [b][i]--device DEV[/i][/b] in the [i]Extra Parameters[/i] field (shown when [i]Advanced View[/i] is enabled). For example, if your optical drive is at [b][i]/dev/sr0[/i][/b], you need to add [b][i]--device /dev/sr0[/i][/b].

Container.Changes:
[font size=4][center]HandBrake Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.15.1[/b][/font] (2019-02-12) - Fixed issue where Intel QSV would not be setup properly when its associated Linux devices where having different owners.
[font size=3][b]v1.15.0[/b][/font] (2019-01-14) - Upgraded HandBrake to version 1.2.0. - The automatic video converter now creates the output folder just before moving the video.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.11[/b][/font] (2018-12-10) - Fixed issue where libraries required to use Intel QSV would not be found.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.10[/b][/font] (2018-12-10) - Fixed issues related to usage of QSV on recent processors: - Added Intel Media driver version 18.3.0. - Upgraded Intel VAAPI driver to version 2.3.0. - Upgraded to Intel Media SDK to version 18.3.1. - Upgraded libva to version 2.3.0. - By default, the new Intel Media driver is now used. - For processors not supported by the Intel Media driver, use the Intel VAAPI driver.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.9[/b][/font] (2018-11-12) - The automatic video converter now processes older files first. - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter would fail to start when `USER_ID` is set to `0`. - Do not setup supplementary group if device for Intel QSV is already accessible. - Added a new log message for a scenario where Intel QSV would not work.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.8[/b][/font] (2018-09-19) - Now using baseimage v3.5.1, which brings the following changes: - Updated installed packages to get latest security fixes.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.7[/b][/font] (2018-09-11) - Upgraded to HandBrake version 1.1.2. - Fixes to the automatic video converter: - Gracefully handle the case where the pre-conversion hook removes the source video file. - Skip unreadable files. - Drop root privileges at start. - Better handling of unexisting cache files.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.6[/b][/font] (2018-07-30) - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter would fail to convert video with multiple titles. - Make sure to apply the `HANDBRAKE_DEBUG` environment variable to the automatic video converter.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.5[/b][/font] (2018-07-19) - A video being converted is now written to a temporary directory before being moved to its final location.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.4[/b][/font] (2018-07-17) - Fixed an issue where HandBrake could crash while encoding a video using x264.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.3[/b][/font] (2018-07-16) - Added support for debug images.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.2[/b][/font] (2018-07-13) - Upgraded HandBrake to version 1.1.1. - Reduced the size of the container image.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.1[/b][/font] (2018-07-12) - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter would not be able to access the device required to enable Intel Quick Sync Video hardware-accelerated encoding.
[font size=3][b]v1.14.0[/b][/font] (2018-07-09) - Added support for Intel Quick Sync Video hardware-accelerated encoding. - Now using baseimage v3.4.0, which is based on Alpine Linux 3.8. - Fixed issue where selecting a different video encoder would result in incorrect video preset selection. - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter would choose an incorrect output subfolder when `SAME_AS_SRC` is used. - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter, during source cleanup, would try to remove the watch folder itself. - Fixed an issue where the automatic video converter would choose an incorrect output filename when the source is a DVD/Blu-Ray folder.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.5[/b][/font] (2018-06-18) - Fixed nightly build.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.4[/b][/font] (2018-06-11) - Fixed nightly build.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.3[/b][/font] (2018-05-21) - Moved the HandBrake debug log under the proper directory. - Fixed the nightly build.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.2[/b][/font] (2018-05-09) - Fixed issue where handling DVD structure would cause a crash.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.1[/b][/font] (2018-04-26) - Improved fix for FLAC encoder crash.
[font size=3][b]v1.13.0[/b][/font] (2018-04-09) - Upgraded HandBrake to version 1.1.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.12.0[/b][/font] (2018-03-22) - Added pre-conversion hook for the automatic video converter. - Added support for creation of image based on the latest HandBrake development code. - Switched to a baseimage based on Alpine Linux 3.7.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.5[/b][/font] (2018-03-02) - Now using baseimage v3.3.4, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Make sure the log monitor is started after the X server. - Fixed an issue where the log monitor `yad` target would use XDG folders of the application. - Fixed issue where log monitor states were not cleared during container startup.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.4[/b][/font] (2018-03-01) - Since HandBrake doesn't work well with ffmpeg, reverted to libav. - Thus, the FLAC encoder crash has been fixed in libav instead. - Make sure the main window is always visible in background.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.3[/b][/font] (2018-02-13) - Fixed an issue where encoding audio to FLAC would cause a crash. - Use AAC encoder from libavcodec. - Fixed an issue where automatic conversion of a multi-titles medias would produce only the first one. - Improved logging of the automatic video converter while processing multi-titles medias.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.2[/b][/font] (2018-02-03) - Now using baseimage v3.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Restored timezone support in Alpine Linux images with glibc. - Fixed issue in `add-pkg` helper where a package could be incorrectly detected as installed.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.1[/b][/font] (2018-01-30) - Now using baseimage v3.3.1, which brings the following changes: - Adjusted the way some ressources are accessed to better support reverse proxy to the container.
[font size=3][b]v1.11.0[/b][/font] (2018-01-22) - Now using baseimage v3.3.0, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - For Alpine Linux images with glibc, automatically update dynamic linker's cache after new libraries are installed. - Fixed the LANG environment variable not being set properly. - Added the ability to automatically install a CJK (Chinese/Japanese/Korean) font.
[font size=3][b]v1.10.0[/b][/font] (2018-01-18) - Added support for multiple watch folders. - Added environment variable to set the interval at which the automatic video converter checks for new files. - Source file and HandBrake preset name are now passed to the post hook script.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.4[/b][/font] (2018-01-11) - Now using baseimage v3.2.2, which brings the following changes (since last used version): - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.2. - Upgraded glibc to version 2.26 (Alpine Linux glibc images). - Adjusted the way ownership of /config is taken to better support cases where the folder is mapped to a network share. - Small adjustment to the way ownership of files are taken.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.3[/b][/font] (2017-12-12) - Now using baseimage v3.1.4, which brings the following changes: - Set 2 worker processes for nginx.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.2[/b][/font] (2017-11-20) - Now using baseimage v3.1.3, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.1. - Better output of automated conversions: encoding progress now seen in container's log, while detailed output is redirected to a log file.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.1[/b][/font] (2017-11-07) - Now using baseimage v3.1.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed an issue where a self-disabled service could be restarted. - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.0. - Use a more efficient way to monitor status files.
[font size=3][b]v1.9.0[/b][/font] (2017-10-29) - Now using baseimage v3.1.0, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.1.1. - Enhanced integration of service dependencies functionality. - Added a simple log monitor. - Fixed race condition where container's exit code would not be the expected one. - Fixed issue where application's GUI fails to displayed when accessing it through the web interface via standard ports 80/443.
[font size=3][b]v1.8.0[/b][/font] (2017-10-09) - Now using baseimage v3.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Better support for service dependencies. - Added support for secure access to the application's GUI.
[font size=3][b]v1.7.0[/b][/font] (2017-09-18) - Added support for optical drive(s) access. - Removed some useless shortcuts in the video source selection window.
[font size=3][b]v1.6.1[/b][/font] (2017-09-08) - Now using baseimage v2.0.8, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Fixed timezone support on alpine-glibc images. - Fixed duplicated entries in /etc/passwd and /etc/group that were created after a restart of the container.
[font size=3][b]v1.6.0[/b][/font] (2017-08-16) - Added libdvdcss to allow reading of encrypted DVD video files.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.9[/b][/font] (2017-08-14) - Now using baseimage v2.0.6, which brings the following changes: - Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.20.0.0.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.8[/b][/font] (2017-08-12) - Fixed conversion of videos containing multiple titles.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.7[/b][/font] (2017-07-31) - Now using baseimage v2.0.5, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Clear the environment of the container during startup. - Clear the /tmp folder during startup. - Cleanly terminate the X server when container is restarted/stopped. - Improved robustness of X server starting process. - Removed unneeded files from the image.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.6[/b][/font] (2017-07-27) - Watch folder: recursively remove empty directories.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.5[/b][/font] (2017-07-27) - Now using baseimage v2.0.3, which brings the following changes: - Improved robustness of the X server starting process.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.4[/b][/font] (2017-07-26) - Watch folder: properly support video discs (ISO files, DVD/Blu-ray folders). - Watch folder: when removing empty folders, ignore the watch folder itself. - Watch folder: make sure to abort if destination file already exists.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.3[/b][/font] (2017-07-25) - Fixed HandBrake CLI crash that was occuring when working with ISO files or DVD folders. - Small adjustments to the default configuration file.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.2[/b][/font] (2017-07-23) - Now using baseimage v2.0.2, which brings the following changes: - Proper VNC port is exposed.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.1[/b][/font] (2017-07-18) - Now using baseimage v2.0.1, which brings the following changes: - Internal enhancements. - Clean temporary files left by npm.
[font size=3][b]v1.5.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-17) - Now using baseimage v2.0.0, which brings the following changes: - Various internal enhancements. - Fixed the way a service waits for another one. - Watch folder: ignore hidden files and folders. - Watch folder: adjusted the way empty folders are removed.
[font size=3][b]v1.4.0[/b][/font] (2017-07-04) - Watch folder: Make sure to respect the configured umask. - Now using baseimage v1.5.0, which brings the following changes: - Added the UMASK environment variable to control how file permissions are set for newly created files. - Added the X11VNC_EXTRA_OPTS environment variable used to pass additional arguments to the x11vnc server. - By default, activate auto-scaling of application's window. - Applied latest Alpine Linux security updates.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.3[/b][/font] (2017-06-30) - Watch folder: Added handling of environment variable AUTOMATED_CONVERSION_OUTPUT_SUBDIR, which allows customization of the output location of automatically converted videos.. - The default source folder is now /storage.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.2[/b][/font] (2017-06-27) - Watch folder: also process files in subfolders.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.1[/b][/font] (2017-06-22) - Now using baseimage v1.4.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated Alpine Linux to version 3.6.2.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-21) - Now using baseimage v1.4.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Switched to Alpine Linux 3.6. - Associate the application's icon to a unique version to avoid browser cache issues. - Fixed prefix of some service related messages. - Added support for supplying supplementary groups of the application. - Improved process startup and shutdown. - When container is stopped or restarted, processes are now terminated gracefully and in proper order. This allow the GUI application to execute its termination routine. - No more error messages when container is stopped or restarted.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-31) - Added support for post-conversion hook.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.4[/b][/font] (2017-05-30) - Now using baseimage v1.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed password modal window not showing up when required.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.3[/b][/font] (2017-05-26) - Watch folder: Fixed issue where, after a first successful conversion, conversion of next available video files would not start. - Renamed the 'Watch Folder' service to 'Automatic Video Converter'.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.2[/b][/font] (2017-05-24) - Watch folder: Changed the way files being transferred are detected. Method used previously was not working properly in all cases.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-24) - Watch folder: temporarily skip files being accessed/transferred. - Watch folder: improved robustness.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-23) - Watch folder: properly support filenames containing spaces. - Watch folder: added support for symbolic links. - HandBrake debug can now be enabled via the HANDBRAKE_DEBUG environment variable. - Take ownership of the `/output` folder. - Added the ability to remove video source files from the watch folder after successfully conversion.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-18) - The watch folder is now monitored without inotify for better compatibility.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-18) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Watch Directory
Config.Description: This is the watch folder of the automatic video converter. Any video copied into this folder will be automatically converted by HandBrake.<br>Container path: /watch

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: This is the default output folder for converted videos. Also used by the automatic video converter.<br>Container path: /output

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Secure Connection
Config.Description: Whether or not an encrypted connection should be used to access the application's GUI. Set to <i><b>1</b></i> to encrypt the connection.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Note:</b></span> When enabling the secure connection, security parameters needs to be generated. This <b>one-time</b> operation is done during container startup. Depending on your system, this could take a few minutes. GUI of the application won't be available until the operation completes.

Config.Name: Extra x11vnc Options
Config.Description: Extra options to pass to the x11vnc server running in the Docker container.<br><span style='color: red;'><b>Warning:</b></span> For advanced users. Do not use unless you know what you are doing.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Preset
Config.Description: Preset used by the automatic video converter. Name of all available presets can be seen via the HandBrake GUI.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Format
Config.Description: Video container format used by the automatic video converter for output files. This is typically the video filename extension.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Keep Source Files
Config.Description: Set to 0 to remove successfully converted videos from the watch folder, 1 to keep them.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Output Subdirectory
Config.Description: Subdirectory of the output folder into which converted videos should be written.<ul><li>Leave value empty to save converted videos directly into <b><i>/output/</i></b>.</li><li>Use the special value <b><i>SAME_AS_SRC</i></b> to use the same subfolder as the source. For example, if the video source file is <b><i>/watch/Movies/mymovie.mkv</i></b>, the converted video will be written to <b><i>/output/Movies/</i></b>.</li><li>Use any subfolder name. For example, setting the value <b><i>Home/Movies</i></b> will make converted videos written to <b><i>/output/Home/Movies</i></b>/</li></ul>

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Source File Stable Time
Config.Description: Time (in seconds) during which properties (e.g. size, time, etc) of a video file in the watch folder need to remain the same. This is to avoid processing a file that is being copied.

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Minimum Title Duration
Config.Description: Minimum title duration (in seconds). Shorter titles will be ignored. This applies only to video disc sources (ISO file, <i>VIDEO_TS</i> folder or <i>BDMV</i> folder).

Config.Name: Automatic Video Converter: Check Interval
Config.Description: Interval (in seconds) at which the automatic video converter checks for new files.

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol. Optional if no VNC client is used.
